poem:
**The Worth of Coin**

Pennies for thoughts, nickels for dreams,
Dollars stretch longer than they seem.
A study quantifies joy in weight,
But laughter's free, despite the rate.
In the ledger of life, values slide,
Yet, love remains the true gold tide.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New study finds increasingly positive link between money and happiness This just in: money apparently does buy happiness. A new study conducted by a senior fellow at the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania found an increasingly positive association between money and happiness. Matt Killingsworth, who tracks happiness for his large-scale research project, trackyourhappiness.org, sampled 33,269 employed US adults aged 18-65 with household incomes of at least $10,000 each year, who answered questions on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
